university_data.university_name:
Washington University of Science and Technology

Evidence:

The name "Washington University of Science and Technology" is explicitly stated on the university's official website, wust.edu. For example, the "History & Development of WUST" page clearly identifies the institution as "Washington University of Science and Technology (WUST)". Similarly, the Student Portal and other pages on the website consistently refer to the university by this name.
university_data.total_graduate_programs:
3

Evidence:

The "Graduate Programs" page on the official website of the Washington University of Science and Technology (wust.edu) explicitly lists the following three master's degree programs:

*   Master of Science in Cybersecurity (MSCS)
*   Master Of Business Administration (MBA)
*   Master Of Science In Information Technology (MSIT)

This information can be found at the following URL: [https://wust.edu/graduate-programs/](https://wust.edu/graduate-programs/)

address_data.street1:
2900 Eisenhower Avenue.

Evidence: The official website for the Washington University of Science and Technology (WUST), wust.edu, explicitly states the street address on its "Contact Information" page. The address is listed as "Our Address. Washington University of Science and Technology (WUST). 2900 Eisenhower Avenue, Alexandria, VA 22314." This address is also consistent across other pages on the university's website, such as the "Center for Student Success" and in the footer of various pages.
address_data.county:
null

Evidence: The official website of the Washington University of Science and Technology (WUST) lists its address as "2900 Eisenhower Avenue, Alexandria, VA 22314" on its contact information page (https://www.wust.edu/contact-information/). However, Alexandria is an independent city in Virginia and is not located within a county. Therefore, the county is not explicitly stated on the university's website because it is not applicable.

application_data.application_requirements:
### Undergraduate Application Requirements:

*   Application Form: Applicants must submit an online application.
*   High School Diploma and Official Transcript: A copy of the high school diploma and official high school transcript are required.
*   Proof of English Proficiency: This is required for applicants who have not received at least four years of instruction in English from an accredited institution in the United States, Canada, Australia, or the United Kingdom. Acceptable proofs include:
    *   TOEFL score of 78 (iBT)
    *   IELTS score of 6.0
    *   iTEP score of 3.7
    *   PTE score of 50
    *   WAEC score of C6
    *   Duolingo English Test (DET) score of 100
    *   TOEIC score of 800
*   Degree Evaluation: Applicants with foreign credentials must have a general degree evaluation conducted by a member of the National Association of Credential Evaluation Services (NACES) to ensure their high school diploma is equivalent to a U.S. high school diploma.
*   Statement of Purpose: While not required, a 150-250 word statement about why the applicant wants to attend WUST is highly recommended.

### Graduate Application Requirements:

*   Application Form: Applicants must submit an online application.
*   Bachelor's Degree and Official Transcripts: A copy of the bachelor's degree and the full academic transcript from an accredited institution are required. The bachelor's degree must be equivalent to a 4-year bachelor's degree in the U.S.
*   Proof of English Proficiency: The same requirements as for undergraduate applicants apply.
*   Degree Evaluation: Applicants with foreign credentials must have a general degree evaluation conducted by a member of the National Association of Credential Evaluation Services (NACES) to ensure their bachelor's degree is equivalent to a 4-year U.S. bachelor's degree.
*   Statement of Purpose: A 150-250 word statement is highly recommended but not mandatory.

The above information is explicitly stated on the Washington University of Science and Technology's "Domestic Admission Requirements" page, which can be found at: https://www.wust.edu/admission-requirements.
application_data.courses_and_grades:
Washington University of Science and Technology (WUST) does not explicitly state detailed course and grade requirements for admission on its official website, wust.edu.

A thorough review of the university's website did not yield specific information regarding required high school courses, minimum grade point averages (GPAs), or standardized test score ranges for undergraduate or graduate applicants.

While the website outlines the various undergraduate and graduate programs offered, including Bachelor's degrees in Business Administration and Information Technology, and Master's degrees in Business Administration, Cybersecurity, and Information Technology, it does not provide quantifiable academic prerequisites for admission to these programs.

Prospective students are encouraged to visit the university's official website for information on the admissions process. However, for specific details on course and grade requirements, direct contact with the university's admissions office is necessary. The absence of this information on the website means that no evidence can be provided for explicitly stated requirements.
application_data.personal_essay:
Not Required.

Evidence:
The Washington University of Science and Technology's official website, on both its "Domestic Admission Requirements" and "International Admission" pages, states the following regarding a Statement of Purpose: "At this time, the statement or purpose is not required, but it is highly recommended. Applicants may submit 150-250 words about why they want to attend WUST or their goals and aspirations."

URL:

*   International Admission: https://www.wust.edu/international-admission/

application_data.additional_information:
All applicants must complete an online learning assessment tool to evaluate their technical skills and readiness for distance education. For applicants with degrees from outside the United States, a formal degree evaluation from a NACES member is required to determine equivalency to a U.S. degree. Additionally, a course-by-course degree evaluation is necessary for those wanting to transfer credits from an international institution.

Evidence can be found on the "Domestic Admission Requirements" page of the Washington University of Science and Technology website (wust.edu).

student_statistics_data.grad_avg_tuition:
null

Evidence: The average graduate tuition is not explicitly stated on the university's tuition page: https://www.wust.edu/tuitions/.
student_statistics_data.ug_scholarship_high:
50%

Evidence:

The Washington University of Science and Technology's "Tuition Assistance" webpage explicitly states two scholarship opportunities that can reach up to 50% of tuition for undergraduate students.

1.  Young Scholars Program: This program provides a scholarship equivalent to 50% of tuition for the first quarter of study. From the second quarter onwards, recipients receive an additional 20% assistance on top of the Academic Merit Tuition Assistance. The highest tier of the Academic Merit (Presidential) scholarship for undergraduates is 30% for a CGPA of 3.90-4.00. Therefore, a high-achieving student in the Young Scholars program could potentially receive a combined scholarship of 50% from their second quarter onwards.

2.  Matching Scholarship: The university offers to match external scholarships awarded by U.S. based businesses or organizations. The award amount will be the exact percentage or dollar amount of the external scholarship, with the policy stating that "In no circumstances, a student can receive more than 50% WUST scholarship towards his/her program tuition calculated per quarter."

The evidence can be found on the following page:
*   WUST Tuition Assistance: https://www.wust.edu/tuition-assistance

boolean_fields_data.is_els_required:
False
Evidence: The Washington University of Science and Technology's "International Admission" page states, "A student who has successfully completed the advanced levels (CEFR C1 Level) from a WUST Partner English Language Program accredited by an agency recognized by the U.S. Department of Education and submits the official proof of completion will be considered to have satisfactory English proficiency." This indicates that completion of a partner English language program is one way to satisfy the requirement, but it is not mandatory. The "Proving English Proficiency" page lists several other accepted tests and scores, such as TOEFL, IELTS, iTEP, PTE, WAEC, Duolingo English Test, TOEIC, and Cambridge Assessment International Education. This confirms that there are multiple ways to demonstrate English proficiency, and ELS is not a specific requirement for all applicants.
boolean_fields_data.is_english_not_required:
False
Evidence: On its "Domestic Admission Requirements" page, the Washington University of Science and Technology website states, "Any applicant who has received at least 4 years of instruction in English from an accredited institution in the United States, Canada, Australia, or the United Kingdom is not required to submit proof of English proficiency. All other applicants are required to submit proof of English proficiency." The page then lists minimum required scores for tests such as TOEFL, IELTS, and Duolingo. The "International Admission" page also explicitly states, "Applicants are required to provide evidence of English proficiency to be admitted into the university."
boolean_fields_data.is_gmat_required:
True
Evidence: A page on the Washington University of Science and Technology's Global Campus website explicitly states, "Our admissions process is streamlined—no SAT® or no GRE or no GMAT required". This indicates that the GMAT is not a requirement for admission. The information can be found on the "Washington University of Science and Technology Ranks Among The Top MBA in Project Management Degree Programs in the U.S." page.
boolean_fields_data.is_gre_required:
False

*   https://wust.edu/global-campus/
boolean_fields_data.is_ielts_required:
True

Evidence: The Washington University of Science and Technology (WUST) website explicitly states that an IELTS score is required for international students who have not received their education in English. The "International Admission" page lists an "IELTS score of 6.0" as one of the accepted proofs of English proficiency.

This requirement is also mentioned in an "English Proficiency Waiver Request Form" from the university, which indicates that a minimum IELTS score of 6.0 is necessary for those who do not qualify for a waiver. However, the university does offer exemptions from this requirement for applicants who have received at least four years of instruction in English from an accredited institution in specific countries or are citizens of certain English-speaking countries.
boolean_fields_data.is_lsat_required:
After a thorough review of the official website of the Washington University of Science and Technology (wust.edu), there is no explicit statement regarding a requirement for the Law School Admission Test (LSAT) for any of its programs.

The university's graduate programs, which include Master's degrees in Business Administration, Cybersecurity, and Information Technology, do not list the LSAT as a required entrance examination in their admission criteria. The admission requirements detailed on the university's website focus on prior academic qualifications, work experience, and in some cases, other standardized tests more relevant to the specific field of study, but not the LSAT.

Therefore, based on the information explicitly available on wust.edu, the LSAT is not a required component for admission to the Washington University of Science and Technology.

null
